title.narrative: 3 CHILD HEALTH INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Increased national capacity to provide access to essential high-impact child health interventions, which contributes to Child Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, strengthened health systems, ensure that children and women have equitable access to and use, improved and quality, high- impact maternal, neonatal and child health interventions and adopt healthy

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national capacity to provide access to essential high-impact child health interventions

description.narrative: 1,504,443 cases of malaria; 87,046 pneumonia cases; and 287,108 diarrhoea cases treated by community oriented resource persons through iCCM platform in Adamawa and Kebbi States. Also, UNICEF provided financial and technical support that led to iCCM treatment services being successfully implemented in 831 settlements of 12 LGAs in Kaduna State. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of LGAs implementing iCCM for Malaria, pneumonia and Diarrhea

actual.value: 2015:ICCM implementation is ongoing in 42 LGAs in Adamawa and Kebbi. Delta State has trained 45 resource Persons in readiness for iCCM implementation in 2 LGAs of the State. So far a total number of 35,395 children have been reached with iCCM services as against a total of 6,118 in 2014 – pneumonia 4,2

title.narrative: Proportion of health facilities supported experiencing no stock-outs of key tracer child health commodities in the last one month

actual.value: 2015:Nationally, 91,5% of HFs did not experience stock-out of 13 Life Saving Commodities in 2015. UNICEF, with support from the EU, BMGF, DFATD, GOJ, contributed to this success story. UNICEF procured and distributed MNCH tracer commodities to the 451 health facilities (1 per ward) in Adamawa and Kebbi

title.narrative: Percentage of health workers with appropriate skills to provide IMNCI (Pneumonia, Malaria and Diarrhea)

baseline.value: To be determined by SARA survey (2015)

actual.value: 2015:1,262 HCWs trained on various MNCH thematic areas along the continuum of care including 33 HCWs on HCT in Adamawa and 23 Nurses on ICCM in Delta State. About 2,480 Community Oriented Resource Persons (CORPs) trained in Adamawa and Kebbi States to roll out the implementation of iCCM in over 1500 Ha
